title: US retaliatory strikes hit Iran-linked targets in Syria and Iraq
summary: In response to a drone strike that killed three American troops in Jordan last weekend, the US military launched airstrikes that hit more than 85 targets.

title: Anatomy of a French failure at the Oscars
summary: Justine Triet's 'Anatomy of a Fall' was rejected in favor of 'The Taste of Things' to represent France at the Oscars, a decision that has come back to haunt everyone involved.

title: Six Nations 2024: Ireland crush France in opening match
summary: Ruthless Ireland began its Six Nations title defense by crushing an undisciplined France 38-17 at Stade Velodrome in Marseille on Friday.

title: Drug trafficking: The new routes for cocaine deliveries on France's Atlantic coast
summary: Bales of drugs have been washing up on the beaches of western France at an unprecedented rate in recent months. To avoid major ports, traffickers are increasingly resorting to 'drop-offs,' which are intended to be picked up by a second boat.

title: Opioid crisis: Publicis agrees to $350 million settlement with US justice system
summary: According to New York Attorney General Letitia James, this marks the first settlement involving an advertising agency for its role in the opioid crisis. The epidemic has claimed some 700,000 lives in 25 years.

title: AFCON 2024: Nigeria and DR Congo secure decisive wins to reach semi-finals
summary: Ademola Lookman's third tournament goal led Nigeria to a 1-0 victory over Angola, while ex-West Ham United defender Arthur Masuaku's crucial goal contributed to the Democratic Republic of Congo's 3-1 win against Guinea.

title: Gaza health crisis could prove more deadly than bombs
summary: While Israeli attacks have already caused more than 25,000 deaths in the Gaza Strip, they have also affected the environment and exposed residents to equally deadly risks.

title: French PM Attal folds on environmental measures to quell farmers' anger
summary: Prime Minister Gabriel Attal accepted most of the FNSEA farmers' union's demands. In response, the union agreed to lift roadblocks near Paris and around the country.

title: Debate grows on the revival of conscription in the UK
summary: High-ranking military officers have said the UK is not preparing for the possibility of a major conflict, and suggested the country's capabilities could be strengthened through conscription, which was suspended in 1960.

title: Carl Weathers, Apollo Creed in 'Rocky' films, dies at 76
summary: The Hollywood action movie and comedy star was also known for his roles in 'Predator' and the Star Wars spin-off series 'The Mandalorian.'

title: UK teenagers sentenced for 'sadistic' murder of trans girl
summary: The pair were named publicly after the judge in the case agreed to lift an anonymity order. They received life sentences for killing Brianna Ghey in February last year.

title: Earning $39 billion in profits in 2023, Meta soars on the stock market
summary: Wall Street is being crushed by the seven tech giants, who are riding the wave of artificial intelligence. Together, they account for more than a third of the S&P 500 index of the 500 largest US companies.

title: Russia could disqualify candidate hoping to stand against Putin
summary: Boris Nadezhdin's hopes of challenging the current president could be dashed by claims of the names of dead people being on his list of signatures collected in support of his candidacy.

title: Wong Kar-wai's first TV series revisits Shanghai's economic boom
summary: 'Blossoms Shanghai,' by the acclaimed Hong Kong director, has been enthusiastically received, particularly by a city nostalgic for the  1990s and its era of opportunity.

title: Life in the areas 'liberated' by anti-junta fighters in Myanmar
summary: Outside of a line of encircled military bases, the countryside in Kayah State in eastern Myanmar, on the border with Thailand, is under the control of the local resistance movement, born from a fusion of anti-junta forces and ethnic Karenni guerrilla fighters.

title: Mafia boss who escaped prison using bedsheets arrested in Corsica
summary: Marco Raduano had been serving a 24-year prison sentence for membership of a criminal organization, drug trafficking, holding illegal weapons and other crimes, according to Europol.

title: UK judge throws out charges against Greta Thunberg and other protesters
summary: The climate activist and four other protesters had been charged with disrupting access to a major oil and gas conference last October.

title: How EU leaders forced Viktor Orban to fold and support Ukraine aid
summary: Meeting in Brussels on Thursday, January 2, EU leaders unanimously adopted a €50 billion financial aid package for Kyiv over four years, a decision which had been blocked in December by the Hungarian prime minister.

title: France trains Ukrainian soldiers in the rules of war
summary: Some 30 military personnel attended a training session in December 2023. Others will do the same in March.

title: France agrees to ratify the EU Artificial Intelligence Act after seven months of resistance
summary: The draft European regulation on artificial intelligence took a decisive step forward on Friday, receiving unanimous endorsement from all 27 European Union member countries.

title: Climbing: The many benefits of a sport accessible to all
summary: Increasingly popular, this activity is also developing for people with disabilities. Here's a report from a gym that caters to autistic people.

title: French farmers on why they struggle
summary: Farmers from around France told Le Monde about their problems and frustrations, which are as varied as their activities, and the land itself.

title: Beyond simply supporting Israel, the US seeks a more comprehensive Middle East strategy
summary: To redress the US's current diplomatic isolation, Joe Biden has signed an executive order punishing Jewish settlers responsible for violence in the West Bank.

title: Madrid's Thyssen Museum hangs on to Pissarro painting looted by Nazis
summary: Although a California appeals court ruled in favor of the cultural institution against the descendants of the despoiled Jewish family, the legal victory is causing unease.

title: Paris: Several people injured in Gare de Lyon knife attack, one man arrested
summary: According to a provisional police report, the attack left one person seriously injured, with a non-life-threatening prognosis, and two slightly injured. The attacker's motives are still unknown.

title: Nicaragua, a thriving hub for US-bound migrants
summary: Managua organizes the arrival on its territory of many people from the continent and also from Africa and Asia, seeking to reach North America. The country reaps a financial windfall from this and sees it as a way of embarrassing Washington.

title: The ongoing struggle to mobilize young Ukrainians to join up
summary: Some recruitment centers resort to heavy-handed methods, while the age of conscription could be lowered from 27 to 25.

title: US strikes back at pro-Iranian militias in Syria and Iraq but avoids direct confrontation with Tehran
summary: The bombing of seven sites was in response to the death of three American soldiers in a drone attack in Jordan, the culmination of a campaign against Washington's troops by groups close to Iran.

title: From beef tongues to yuzu fruit: The extraordinary world of the Rungis market
summary: The world's largest fresh produce market, just south of Paris, feeds 18 million people and has an annual turnover of €10,299 million.

title: AFCON 2024: Mali versus Côte d'Ivoire is an athletic and political showdown
summary: The two West African neighbors face off on Saturday in the quarter-finals of the Africa Cup of Nations. While there is a large Malian diaspora in Côte d'Ivoire, political relations between Abidjan and Bamako are strained.

title: For the first time, an Irish nationalist will lead Northern Ireland's government
summary: Sinn Féin Vice President Michelle O'Neill was nominated as first minister as the government returned to work after a two-year boycott by unionists.
